alert.note: Alert for Huron; Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 28 at 12:27PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW CONTINUES THIS AFTERNOON NEAR THUMB SHORELINE... WEATHER... * Bands of lake effect snow continue moving in from Lake Huron through mid afternoon. The primary activity migrated from near Lexington to Port Sanilac during the morning and is now expected to be focused from about Forester to Harbor Beach and points inland for the rest of the afternoon. Lighter snow showers are also still possible all along the Lake Huron shoreline. * Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches are expected near the Lake Huron shoreline during the afternoon. Total accumulation since this morning of near 4 inches is possible in localized shoreline areas. IMPACTS... * Low visibility and sudden visibility changes for motorists along with hazardous driving conditions on untreated roads. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
